comments:
Potential SWT issue, but I'll start with CDT first.
CDT 2.0.0.200406230
Eclipse 3.0RC3

1. Create a Std Make C++ project
2. Create a subdir within that project
3. Project > Properties > C/C++ Project Paths > Source tab.
4. Click the Add Folder... button
The Source Folder Selection (SFS) dialog appears.
5. Move the SFS dialog.
6. Cancel the SFS dialog, or close it using the X control.
7. OK (not Cancel) to dismiss the Properties dialog.
The following appears on the console which started Eclipse:
Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Widget is disposed

The following appears in the .log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 24, 2004 11:03:22.242
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 24, 2004 11:03:22.243

!STACK 0

Does not occur on Windows.

> Assigning to Hoda for investigation.

Let Dave handle it, he may already have a fix.

Thanks Hoda.

Ok, I've added some more isDisposed checks in the async display calls, I don't
have linux so could you hammer on these pages to see if it still happens.

Thanks
